docs.lead_paragraph: Get caught up on the day’s top stories.
docs.snippet: Get caught up on the day’s top stories.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Whelan was an epidemiologist who started a national organization to question conventional wisdom on food, chemicals and the environment.

headline.main: Elizabeth Whelan, Who Challenged Food Laws, Dies at 70
headline.print_headline: Elizabeth Whelan Dies at 70; Challenged Food Laws

docs.abstract: Elizabeth Whelan, epidemiologist who started a national organization to question conventional wisdom on food, chemicals and the environment, dies at age 70.
docs.snippet: Ms. Whelan was an epidemiologist who started a national organization to question conventional wisdom on food, chemicals and the environment.

keywords.value: American Council on Science and Health
keywords.name: organizations

docs.lead_paragraph: A report from a group of retired military leaders, which has campaigned for improved childhood nutrition, shines a light on obesity in the military and its risks to readiness.

headline.main: Poor Fitness in Military Poses Peril, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Poor Fitness in Military Poses Peril, Report Says

docs.abstract: Group of retired military leaders fighting for improved childhood nutrition says increase in number of overweight and out-of-shape service members who are unable to run long distances or perform physical tasks like push-ups poses direct threat to ability of United States to defend itself; says 12 percent of active-duty service members are obese, up 61 percent since 2002.
docs.snippet: A report from a group of retired military leaders, which has campaigned for improved childhood nutrition, shines a light on obesity in the military and its risks to readiness.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Artificial Sweeteners May Disrupt Body's Blood Sugar Controls
headline.print_headline: Artificial Sweeteners Alter Metabolism, Study Finds

docs.abstract: New research in mice suggests artificial sweeteners may disrupt the ability to regulate blood sugar, causing changes in metabolism that can be a precursor to diabetes.
docs.snippet: New research in mice suggests artificial sweeteners may disrupt the ability to regulate blood sugar, causing changes in metabolism that can be a precursor to diabetes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Activist investor Nelson Peltz's Trian Fund Management LP urged DuPont to break itself up, saying that efforts already underway at the industrial conglomerate to shed some of its businesses were not enough to fix what it called the company's "underperformance."

headline.main: Activist Investor Peltz Pushes DuPont to Split Itself
headline.print_headline: Activist Investor Peltz Pushes DuPont to Split Itself

docs.snippet: Activist investor Nelson Peltz's Trian Fund Management LP urged DuPont to break itself up, saying that efforts already underway at the industrial conglomerate to shed some of its businesses were not enough to fix what it called the company's...

docs.lead_paragraph: Using artificial sweeteners may set the stage for diabetes in some people by hampering the way their bodies handle sugar, suggests a preliminary study done mostly in mice.

headline.main: Study: Artificial Sweeteners May Promote Diabetes
headline.print_headline: Study: Artificial Sweeteners May Promote Diabetes

docs.snippet: Using artificial sweeteners may set the stage for diabetes in some people by hampering the way their bodies handle sugar, suggests a preliminary study done mostly in mice.

docs.lead_paragraph: Cuts to the nation's food stamp program enacted this year are only affecting four states, far from the sweeping overhaul that Republicans had pushed, an Associated Press review has found.

headline.main: Only 4 States Will See Cuts to Food Stamps
headline.print_headline: Only 4 States Will See Cuts to Food Stamps

docs.snippet: Cuts to the nation's food stamp program enacted this year are only affecting four states, far from the sweeping overhaul that Republicans had pushed, an Associated Press review has found.

docs.lead_paragraph: Reports by United Nations agencies showed that a goal of reducing child mortality by two-thirds is years behind.

headline.main: Despite Declines, Child Mortality and Hunger Persist in Developing Nations, U.N. Reports
headline.print_headline: Despite Declines, Child Mortality and Hunger Persist in Developing Nations, U.N. Reports

docs.abstract: United Nations reports significant declines in rates of child mortality and hunger globally, but warns that trends are persisting in parts of Africa and South Asia despite major health care advances and better food production; observes that while goal of halving the number of hungry people by 2015 is still within reach, second goal of reducing child mortality by two-thirds is years behind schedule.
docs.snippet: Reports by United Nations agencies showed that a goal of reducing child mortality by two-thirds is years behind.

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations

byline.original: By RICK GLADSTONE and SOMINI SENGUPTA

docs.lead_paragraph: Leaders of some of the biggest U.S. corporations, from Coca-Cola Co to Johnson & Johnson, unveiled a campaign on Tuesday to reduce the nation's healthcare costs, urging their peers to embrace wellness programs to improve employee health.

headline.main: Coke, J&J Join Big Companies Behind New Employee Wellness Push
headline.print_headline: Coke, J&J Join Big Companies Behind New Employee Wellness Push

docs.snippet: Leaders of some of the biggest U.S. corporations, from Coca-Cola Co to Johnson & Johnson, unveiled a campaign on Tuesday to reduce the nation's healthcare costs, urging their peers to embrace wellness programs to improve employee health.

docs.lead_paragraph: Amid a fierce fight for middle and south Georgia voters, Republican Senate candidate David Perdue is enlisting the support of his cousin, former Gov. Sonny Perdue, in a new statewide television ad that begins airing Tuesday.

headline.main: Georgia Candidate's Ad Stars Cousin, Ex-Governor
headline.print_headline: Georgia Candidate's Ad Stars Cousin, Ex-Governor

docs.snippet: Amid a fierce fight for middle and south Georgia voters, Republican Senate candidate David Perdue is enlisting the support of his cousin, former Gov. Sonny Perdue, in a new statewide television ad that begins airing Tuesday.
